intro: Agathyrsus floridanus, commonly known as the Florida agathyrsus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
